Sentence: In addition to controlling transcription of PROTEIN1 PROTEIN2 appears to control expression of at least one other gene required for production of CSF.
During endospore formation in Bacillus subtilis, the DNA binding protein PROTEIN1 stimulates transcription from several promoters that are used by RNA polymerase containing PROTEIN2

The PROTEIN regulon includes a penicillin binding protein ( PROTEIN and a co-transcribed amino acid racemase ( PROTEIN , homologues of signal peptide peptidase ( PROTEIN , flotillin ( PROTEIN , ABC transporters ( PROTEIN1 , non-haem bromoperoxidase ( PROTEIN , epoxide hydrolase ( PROTEIN2 and three small peptides with structural similarities to bacteriocin precursor polypeptides.
Most PROTEIN genes, and the PROTEIN1 gene, are transcribed by PROTEIN2 RNA polymerase.
In addition to the typical PROTEIN1 dependent, stress- and starvation-inducible pattern, PROTEIN2 is also induced in response to amino acid depletion.
The PROTEIN1 promoter, like the PROTEIN promoter, is believed to be recognized by PROTEIN2 RNA polymerase, suggesting that PROTEIN may inhibit PROTEIN activity late in sporulation.
In vitro transcription experiments suggest that the differential pattern of PROTEIN1 gene expression results from the combined action of PROTEIN2 and another transcription factor, PROTEIN

PROTEIN is controlled by a regulatory cascade involving an anti-sigma factor, PROTEIN an anti-anti-sigma factor, PROTEIN and a membrane-bound phosphatase, PROTEIN1 which converts the inactive, phosphorylated form of PROTEIN2 back to the active form.

The class includes AsiA form bacteriophage T4, which inhibits Escherichia coli sigma 70; PROTEIN1 present in both gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria, which inhibits the flagella sigma factor PROTEIN PROTEIN which inhibits the sporulation-specific sigma factor, PROTEIN and PROTEIN of Bacillus subtilis; PROTEIN2 of B. subtilis, which inhibits stress response sigma factor PROTEIN and PROTEIN a general regulator of the heat shock response, which in bacteria inhibits the heat shock sigma factor PROTEIN
